intro: Leptogramma mollissima, commonly known as the velvet fern, is a unique plant native to the wetlands of South America. It is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grasses. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in swampy or boggy habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
